oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hams
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Ewell Perry, of Ashland City, Tenn., taking a look at his home food supply for the year (in this case, hams). In the photograph, he is inspecting one of the hams that is hanging from the ceiling.
The Home Food Supply Program was a war-relief program instituted by the administration of Gov. Prentice Cooper. Mr. Perry had won national honors as a Future Farmer boy.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Cooper, Prentice, 1895-1969; Swine; Livestock; Swine--Carcasses
Agriculture; Home food processing; Farmers; Pork; Curing (preservation); Smokehouses; War relief
